custom_fields.key_topics:
Learning strategies
Responsible computing
Safe computing
Effective computing
Information literacy
Academic integrity
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Learning activities are interspersed throughout the course readings and are graded for participation. Each unit concludes with a quiz and there is a final exam at the end of the course.
custom_fields.goals: Develop foundational computing and information literacy skills, focusing on the tools and technologies that are specific to Carnegie Mellon so you can be successful in your other academic courses
custom_fields.relevance: Requisite core competencies in academic technologies, information literacy and ethics, values and critical thinking for all degree-seeking, undergraduate students
custom_fields.learning_resources: All of the course materials will be housed in Canvas and the Open Learning Initiative's (OLI) online course environment

long_desc: ComputingCarnegie Mellon CCM is a 3unit, passfail mini course that will help you develop foundational computing and information literacy skills, focusing on the tools and technologies that are specific to Carnegie Mellon so you can be successful in your other academic courses. All undergraduate students are required to take the course.  CCM is offered in a hybrid format through the Open Learning Initiatives OLI online course environment meaning that youll complete your coursework online and attend a facetoface recitation session for review and supplemental instruction.
name: Computing @ Carnegie Mellon
